item.title: 'Lack of care': Optus review into triple-zero outage uncovers widespread issues
item.description: <p>The report found ﻿there were internal gaps, including poor information flow that failed to acknowledge the severity of the outage and siloed structures.</p>

item.title: Teenage boy joins Sea World crash survivors in preparing for personal injury lawsuits
item.description: <p>A teenage boy whose mother was killed in the Sea World helicopter collision has joined some other survivors in preparing personal injury lawsuits against the theme park&#x27;s operator Village Roadshow.</p>

item.title: 'I accept my responsibility': Prime Minister Anthony Albanese makes raw admission on Bondi attack

item.description: <p>Grief-stricken families of those killed in the terrorist attack at Bondi Beach have paid tribute to the victims with moving messages of reflection.</p>

item.title: More than 33,000 cars stolen in Victoria in 12 months, as new stats show crime continues to rise
item.description: <p>A group of 6600 repeat offenders was responsible for a quarter of all crimes in Victoria in the 12 months to September.</p>

item.title: Man banned from Bondi after Jewish 'threat' mid-flight
item.description: <p>A man who allegedly threatened a member of the Jewish community who lost friends in the deadly terrorist attack has been banned from Bondi Beach.</p>

item.title: More Bondi terror attack victims released from hospitals

item.description: <p>Seven men have been arrested by heavily armed police officers in a dramatic operation in Sydney&#x27;s south-west this afternoon.</p>

item.title: Indonesian court sentences an Australian to 12 years in prison for smuggling cocaine to Bali
item.description: <p>An Indonesian court sentenced an Australian citizen to 12 years in prison after finding him guilty of smuggling cocaine to the tourist island of Bali.</p>

item.title: Schools told to keep children inside as polluted fog envelops Bosnian capital
item.description: <p>Flights were cancelled, children were told to stay indoors and outdoors construction work was banned in Sarajevo on Thursday as a thick layer of fog enveloped the Bosnian capital.</p>
